Branching and Merging Exercises

Part I

  • git clean is used to remove untracked and unmerged files
  • -d and -f files is used to remove untracted and unmerged files
  • The git command that creates a branch is git checkout -b "NAME_OF_BRANCH"
  • A fastforward merge is when a git can easitly tell when a commit happens and arrange chronologically while a recursve merge is when a git cannot determine the order in which commits happen
  • The git command that deletes a branch is git branch -D Name of the Branch
  • git reset HEAD name of the file
  • The git diff compares the history of codes
  • This happens when git does not know which commit to go when there are same file on two branches
